macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: Global equities mixed as Nikkei drops on China export controls, eurozone inflation hits ECB target
items.summary: Global equity indices were mixed, with Japan's Nikkei 225 seeing the sharpest losses after China announced new export controls to Japan amid rising tensions over Taiwan. Euro area bond yields fell further as December eurozone inflation printed at 2% year-on-year, pushing out market expectations for the next ECB rate hike to 2028 while U.S. Treasuries were little changed and the curve flattened on signs of a cooling U.S. labor market.

items.title: Wall Street pulls back from record as housing policy comments hit homebuilders
items.summary: The S&P 500 fell 0.3% from a record high, the Dow Jones Industrial Average dropped 0.9%, and the Nasdaq Composite edged up 0.2% as early-year optimism faded. U.S. homebuilder stocks slumped after President Donald Trump said he would move to bar large institutional investors from buying single-family homes, with D.R. Horton down 3.6% and PulteGroup down 3.2%.

items.title: U.S. equity futures edge lower after prior session decline; Alphabet stands out
items.summary: U.S. futures drifted down, with S&P 500 futures off 0.1%, Dow futures down 0.2%, and Nasdaq futures down 0.1% after the Dow’s 0.9% drop in the previous session. Alphabet was a notable outperformer in cash trading, rising 2.4% and lifting its market value to about $3.89 trillion.

items.title: Asian stocks decline as Nikkei slides on tech weakness; Chinese AI rival Zhipu jumps in debut
items.summary: Tokyo’s Nikkei 225 fell 1.6% with pronounced weakness in technology names, as SoftBank dropped 7.6% and chip-equipment maker Tokyo Electron lost 4%. Hong Kong’s Hang Seng index declined 1.2%, while shares of Chinese AI company Zhipu surged roughly 15% above their offer price on their first day of trading.

items.title: Europe opens mostly lower, defense stocks rally on Trump spending plan
items.summary: European equity markets opened mostly lower in line with U.S. and Asian weakness, though defense shares outperformed after President Trump called for U.S. defense spending to reach $1.5 trillion. BAE Systems and Leonardo gained 5.8% and 4.4% respectively, while Germany’s DAX added 0.25% following a record close and the U.K.’s FTSE 100 slipped 0.4%.

items.title: Dollar firms as markets reassess odds of near-term Fed rate cuts ahead of jobs data
items.summary: The U.S. dollar index inched up about 0.1% after recent economic data gave investors little reason to expect another near-term interest-rate cut from the Federal Reserve. Weekly jobless claims and Friday’s nonfarm payrolls report are in focus, with markets also watching a scheduled speech from Fed Governor Stephen Miran for further policy signals.

items.title: Oil slips to $60 as U.S. moves to import Venezuelan crude; defense and Venezuela policy in focus
items.summary: Brent crude fell to about $60 per barrel after President Trump announced the U.S. will import up to $2 billion of Venezuelan crude, reshaping expectations for global supply flows. The shift in Venezuela policy and Trump’s broader defense and domestic policy comments have become key macro drivers for commodity and equity markets.

items.title: Warner Bros. Discovery rejects revised Paramount bid, backs Netflix offer in media deal battle
items.summary: Warner Bros. Discovery rejected a sweetened buyout proposal from Paramount and urged shareholders to support Netflix’s competing offer in an escalating media consolidation fight. In trading following the news, Warner Bros. Discovery gained 0.4%, Netflix edged up 0.1%, and Paramount Skydance slipped 1%.

items.title: AI and chip stocks retreat in Japan as global tech rally pauses
items.summary: Japanese AI- and semiconductor-related stocks led declines in Tokyo, contributing to the 1.6% fall in the Nikkei 225 index. SoftBank Group posted the largest drop among index heavyweights, shedding 7.6% amid a broader pullback in AI and chip names.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin slips back toward $90K as ETF outflows hit $480M
items.summary: Bitcoin retreated below the $90,000 level after an early-January surge, with analysts linking the move to roughly $480 million of net outflows from U.S. spot BTC ETFs and shifting expectations around Federal Reserve rate cuts.

items.title: Crypto market cap hovers around $3.07T as majors trade mixed
items.summary: The global cryptocurrency market capitalization stands near $3.07 trillion, down about 2.5% over the last 24 hours, with Bitcoin trading in a $89.6K–$92.3K range and closing near $90K while many large-cap altcoins post losses between 2–7%.
items.source: Binance Research / CoinMarketCap data via Binance

items.title: Select altcoins ZKP, FXS, GUN soar despite broader market pullback
items.summary: Amid a generally negative day for large-cap crypto assets, smaller-cap tokens ZKP, FXS, and GUN jumped approximately 70%, 62%, and 26% respectively over the last 24 hours, standing out as the day's strongest market movers.

items.title: Bitcoin mining difficulty drops 1.2%, easing pressure on miners
items.summary: Bitcoin network mining difficulty decreased by about 1.2% at block height 931,392, modestly reducing competition among miners and slightly lowering the cost of securing new blocks on the network.

items.title: U.S. Treasury unveils framework for Bitcoin strategic reserve
items.summary: The U.S. Treasury announced the establishment of a Bitcoin strategic reserve structure that, according to market commentary, is being set up initially without direct government purchases of BTC, signaling growing institutionalization of the asset.

items.title: Brazilian presidential candidate calls for national Bitcoin reserve
items.summary: A leading Brazilian presidential candidate publicly advocated the creation of a national Bitcoin reserve, framing BTC as a strategic asset that could diversify the country's holdings and strengthen financial sovereignty.

items.title: U.S. Senate Agriculture Committee to examine crypto market structure
items.summary: The Senate Agriculture Committee, which oversees the CFTC, scheduled a review focused on cryptocurrency market structure, signaling continued legislative interest in clarifying oversight of digital asset spot and derivatives markets.

items.title: SEC crypto task force to hold direct talks in Miami
items.summary: A dedicated SEC cryptocurrency task force is set to visit Miami for direct talks with local industry participants, highlighting the regulator's continued focus on enforcement, compliance, and engagement with U.S.-based crypto businesses.

items.title: XRP whale activity spikes to three‑month high
items.summary: On‑chain data showed a sharp increase in large XRP transfers, with whale activity reaching its highest level in roughly three months, prompting expectations of elevated short‑term volatility in the token's price.

items.title: Crypto markets reprice Fed cut expectations ahead of January decision
items.summary: Derivatives and rate markets now assign a high probability to the Federal Reserve leaving interest rates unchanged at its upcoming meeting, a shift that has coincided with profit‑taking in Bitcoin and Ether after their early‑year rally.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Siemens and NVIDIA launch "Industrial AI OS" for factories and infrastructure
items.summary: Siemens and NVIDIA announced an expanded strategic partnership to create what they call the first "Industrial AI Operating System," aimed at unifying industrial data, physics-based simulation, and AI models to power autonomous and optimized factories and infrastructure.

items.title: Toyota adopts Databricks to power new unified data and AI hub "vista"
items.summary: Toyota Motor Corporation selected the Databricks Data Intelligence Platform as the backbone for its new unified data and AI hub, "vista," which integrates enterprise data to support AI and ML use cases, including natural language analytics with Genie and future deployment of Agent Bricks for agentic AI.

items.title: Raspberry Pi Foundation publishes new framework for teaching AI and data science in schools
items.summary: The Raspberry Pi Computing Education Research Centre released a "data paradigms" framework that argues AI and data science education needs approaches distinct from traditional programming, categorizing systems by transparency and data/knowledge basis and launching a multi-year study with UK primary teachers.

items.title: CIOs warned about "agent sprawl" and tightening AI oversight in 2026
items.summary: A new CIO Dive analysis outlines four key IT leadership trends for 2026, highlighting challenges including the proliferation of AI agents across the enterprise, closer monitoring of evolving AI regulation, and the need to retrain tech talent for AI-centric workflows.

items.title: Southern California Edison, ThinkLabs AI, and Microsoft partner on AI-powered grid automation
items.summary: Southern California Edison announced a collaboration with ThinkLabs AI and Microsoft to use AI to automate grid energization and planning, aiming to handle rapid load growth and accelerate interconnections for new customers and distributed energy resources.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Creator-led New Game+ Showcase to debut with 45 upcoming titles today
items.summary: The new creator-run New Game+ Showcase, organized by Gaming World Media and several prominent content creators, is set to premiere with 45 upcoming AAA and indie games, featuring gameplay and developer interviews; participating studios include Bandai Namco, Ubisoft, Obsidian Entertainment, THQ Nordic, Xbox Game Studios, and various indie teams.

items.title: New Game Plus Showcase promises dozens of new trailers and reveals across Xbox and PC
items.summary: The debut New Game Plus Showcase will air across major streaming platforms, highlighting 45 upcoming Xbox and PC games with new gameplay, interviews, and some world-premiere announcements, positioned as an alternative, creator-driven reveal event without paid placements.

items.title: Report hints at new Xbox hardware, possibly Elite Series 3 controller, expected in 2026
items.summary: A new report on Xbox's 2026 outlook suggests Microsoft plans to release new Xbox hardware this year, likely including a long-rumored Elite Series 3 controller and other controller revisions, with next-gen Xbox controllers said to support direct-to-WiFi connectivity to reduce cloud gaming latency.

items.title: Microsoft reportedly preparing large new wave of layoffs affecting Xbox and game development
items.summary: Commentary on recent reports indicates Microsoft is planning a major round of job cuts in January 2026, with estimates of 11,000–22,000 roles potentially impacted across divisions including Azure and the Xbox unit, raising concerns about canceled projects and studio closures within its gaming operations.

items.title: Local GameStop store in Texas to permanently close as retailer continues footprint reductions
items.summary: A GameStop location in Boerne, Texas is set to permanently close, reflecting the retailer's ongoing contraction of its brick-and-mortar presence amid broader shifts toward digital game distribution and changing retail economics.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Best of CES 2026 highlights major new laptops, TVs, phones, AR glasses and more
items.summary: Tom’s Guide named its top 27 hardware products from CES 2026, spotlighting ultra‑thin TVs, a gaming laptop with a rollable display that expands from 16 to 24 inches, advanced robot vacuums that can climb stairs, new flagship phones, smart glasses, monitors, and mini PCs, with Intel’s new Core Ultra Series 3 ‘Panther Lake’ laptop chips taking Best of Show for major gains in speed and power efficiency over Lunar Lake.

items.title: Intel debuts Core Ultra Series 3 ‘Panther Lake’ mobile processors at CES
items.summary: Intel used its CES keynote to fully unveil its Core Ultra Series 3 ‘Panther Lake’ processors for laptops, demonstrating significantly higher performance and improved power efficiency versus the prior Lunar Lake generation and positioning the chips as the foundation for a new wave of premium and ultraportable notebooks shown across the show floor.

items.title: Willo emerges from stealth with alignment‑free wireless power system demo
items.summary: Finnish deep‑tech startup Willo Technologies publicly launched with a CES demonstration of a wireless power system that can deliver electricity without requiring alignment or directional targeting of devices, addressing a long‑standing limitation of wireless charging; the company stressed this is a technology proof‑of‑concept rather than a consumer product or commercial deal announcement.
